We do not use the issue tracker to ask questions. Please see https://golang.org/wiki/Questions for good places to ask. 

If you find bugs please open a new issue for each new case of a bug.  If you want to propose a detailed code improvement please send a CL: https://golang.org/doc/contribute.html.

In this case it may over allocate but in the most scenarios i would assume width := 3 + f.wid + f.prec is small and just checking if width > len(buf) is faster than having a data dependent branch like the above in addition which makes the common case slower. So my personal opinion is to leave it as is.
